page.title: 01Priors Marston Village
page.content: The village with two Churches, two Public Houses, a Post Office and General Store, school and garage forms the centre for the surrounding farms. Most houses are local stone built and the village is a building conservation area. Both arable and livestock farming are practised, but there is no industry and many people commute up to 40 miles to work. There is a strong sense of community with no evident class barriers. Many social events are organised within the community and held in the Village Hall. A Sports and Social Club provides facilities for football and cricket as well as a licenced clubhouse. With the pleasant countryside and strong local identity, the area forms a welcome contrast to late 20th century urban anonymity.
